org.ancora.jCommons
Class Disk

java.lang.Object
  org.ancora.jCommons.Disk

public class Disk
extends java.lang.Object

Methods for quick and simple manipulation of files, folders and other input/output related operations.

Create a Disk object.

Method Detail

getDisk

public static Disk getDisk()
Returns a Disk with default formatting of messages.

Returns:
a Disk with default formatting of messages.

safeFolder

public java.io.File safeFolder(java.lang.String folderpath)
Given a string representing a filepath to a folder, returns a File object representing the folder. It follows the contiditions:

If the folder exists, a File with its path is returned;
If the folder doesn't exist, it will be created, along with all the necessary folders;
If the folder couldn't be created, null is returned;
If the path represented by the folderpath exists, but doesn't represent a folder, null is returned;

If a File object is returned, it is guaranteed that the folder exists.

Parameters:
folderpath - a string representing a filepath to a folder.
Returns:
if folder exists, a File object representing the folder. Null otherwise.

safeFolder

public java.io.File safeFolder(java.io.File folder,
                               java.lang.String foldername)
Given a File representing a folder, and a String representing the name of another folder inside the previous folder, returns a File object representing the complete folder. It follows the contiditions:

If the folder inside the first folder exists, a File with its path is returned;
If the folder doesn't exist, an attempt is made to create the folder and all the needed folders. If unsucessful, null is returned.
If the complete folderpath exists, but doesn't represent a folder, null is returned;

Parameters:
folder - File representing a folder.
foldername - name of a file inside the folder.
Returns:
if the file exists, a File object representing the file. Null otherwise.

safeFile

public java.io.File safeFile(java.lang.String filepath)
Given a String representing a filepath to a File, returns a File object representing the file. It follows the contiditions:

If the file exists, a File with its path is returned;
If the file doesn't exist, an attempt is made to create an empty file. If unsucessful, null is returned.
If the path represented by the obejct File exists, but doesn't represent a file, null is returned;

If a File object is returned, it is guaranteed that the file exists.

Parameters:
filepath - a string representing a filepath to a file.
Returns:
a File object representing the file. Null otherwise.

safeFile

public java.io.File safeFile(java.io.File folder,
                             java.lang.String filename)
Given a File representing a folder, and a String representing a filepath to a File, returns a File object representing a file inside the folder. It follows the contiditions:

If the file inside the folder exists, a File with its path is returned;
If the folder doesn't exist, an attempt is made to create the folder and all the needed folders. If unsucessful, null is returned.
If the file inside the folder doesn't exist, an attempt is made to create an empty file. If unsucessful, null is returned.
If the complete filepath exists, but doesn't represent a file, null is returned;

Parameters:
folder - File representing a folder.
filename - name of a file inside the folder.
Returns:
if the file exists, a File object representing the file. Null otherwise.

read

public java.lang.String read(java.io.File file)
Given a File representing a file, returns a String with the contents of the file. It follows the contiditions:

If the File object doesn't exist or doesn't represent a file, an empty string is returned;

Parameters:
file - File object representing a file.
Returns:
contents of the file.

write

public void write(java.io.File file,
                  java.lang.String contents)
Given a File representing an existing file and a String, writes the contents of the String in the file, overwritting everything that was previously in the file. It follows the contiditions:

If the File object doesn't exist or doesn't represent a file, nothing is written;

Parameters:
file - File object representing an existing file.
contents - The contents to write.

append

public void append(java.io.File file,
                   java.lang.String contents)
Given a File representing an existing file and a String, writes the contents of the String at the end of the file. It follows the contiditions:

If the File object doesn't exist or doesn't represent a file, nothing is written;

Parameters:
file - File object representing an existing file.
contents - The contents to write.
